page.title: 02A FARM STUDY
page.content: We surveyed three farms in our D Block for the Domesday project;{Hollin Hall, {Barforth Hall and Park Farm. Hollin {Hall}was the largest (385 acres), followed by{Barforth}(330 acres) and {Park Farm}was the smallest (150acres). All the farms carried out mixed farming. They all grew barley, wheat, oil seed rape, and grass. The farms all farm on medium soil. The livestock at{Hollin Hall}is Hereford crossed with Charolais cattle.{Barforth Hall concentrates on sheep livestock, having Suffolk crossed with Mule ewes, ten Suffolk rams, producing 500 lambs. All three farms use fertilisers and weedkillers.{Hollin Farm}employs three people,{Barforth Farm}two, and{Park {Farm}only one person. Each farm has virtually the same machinery, such as tractors, ploughs and cultivators.
